title: Which will happen next regarding the price of Dogecoin?
possible_answers: Dogecoin will have a value of $1.00 or more
Dogecoin will have a value of $0.25 or less
correct_answer: Dogecoin will have a value of $0.25 or less

SIMULATION OUTPUT: LOW:99.53%,HIGH:0.02%

Adjusting again, based on new Monte Carlo results by @cafebdedouin. Averaging:  50% per @slapthepancake + 43% (or thereabouts) per @JonathanMann + 1% per @cafebedouin = 31% Averaging Monte Carlos & my base rate:  31 + 2 = 33.  33 divided by 2 = 16.5 Increasing 16.5 to 20% because of the possibility of volatility due to statements by Elon Musk and market manipulation ala Gamestock.

I look at the chart. . . . .(I don't know how to run a Monte Carlo).    In the last 51 days, it has been below $.25 once (and only touched below there briefly once more), giving a base rate of about 2%. Based on past experience, with 55 days before this question closes automatically, there would seem to be a 2% chance of the price falling below $.25.  However, as they say,  "past performance is no guarantee of future returns", and this is an especially volatile instrument.  Besides, I have used a very short window of data from which to calculate my base rate, so I should consider adjusting it. . . . Some simple math: averaging 2% (based on the last 51 days) and 50% (based on Monte Carlo by @slapthepancake) I get 26%.  Going with that!

Breaks almost 50/50 for below vs. not below $0.25 in the historic Monte Carlo, I'm skewing away from sub-$0.25 since $0.25 makes sense as a support level after its late-April dip and the recent dip on May 23 to $0.24997 before bouncing back up. Due to how the question is resolved that type of support is even more important. I've also been underweighting the $1 or more bucket due to recent stability, so bumping that up a tad. Looking at GME's price history where it was hovering at $40-$50 for three weeks before rocketing back up is helpful in reminding myself that stability won't necessarily last. Coinbase adding the coin is another consideration that bumps the $1+ and Neither buckets for me by 1-2% since it should increase demand a little.

While I'm bullish on crypto longterm, the last 2 months' rise in DOGE is uniquely tenuous because it rises and falls dramatically on the tweets and whims of just one man.
This market might as well be called:
1) Musk or others announce dramatic support for DOGE before Aug 1
2) Musk deems Doge unupgradable, shifts his support to another coin, or otherwise leaves DOGE high and dry.
3) Musk continues his alternate support and criticism==potentially making himself a lot of money--as upgrades are worked on. Who besides him knows what he plans?
Bin 3 seems the most likely, as he can )presumably) continue to milk the ups and downs of the price.
Real upgrades' time to code will not be in time for bin1.  But bin 1 could benefit just from announcements of support.
Bin 2 is made less likely by Musk (and Tesla) now being tied reputationally to Doge. Notably, the price has been particularly volatile.  I'd give an easy > 10% to it surpassing each side of its current range..

My intuition based on important factors I think are relevant gives a 40% chance neither of the first two bins occur before closing date. It is interesting to me that the less intuitive method that is modeling leans way more toward bin 3, whereas the intuition side leans toward the other two bins. The consensus aid (aka the adjusted crowd median), leans more toward bin 2; perhaps most forecasters here are using intuition. It would be interesting to see in this particular instance which method becomes superior and which inferior. In my judgement, it would be better here to rely on these models since our intuition does not fare well with processing unpredictability.
"Dogecoin surges after Coinbase says some users can trade it." I don't see it surging so drastically beyond a dollar; most likely it will stay aound .5

The community seems to very strong and militant so a price at 0.25 or below does not seem logical, additioanlly to that coinbase just announced that it will list doge. The biggest points against the 1USD mark is its volatility and hyper sensitivity to tweets.

There are so many catalysts, maybe of which dont make sense and are unpredictable, the amount of news or rumours that can flip it above or below either of those thresholds makes me thing its possible,

¯\_(ツ)_/¯ Coinbase will start allowing trades of it in the next 6-8 weeks (https://www.cnbc.com/2021/05/14/dogecoin-rallies-on-elon-musk-tweet-anticipated-coinbase-listing.html) so that may spike the price over $1, maybe it'll retest its lows over some random event or happening in the crypto world and tank. Prior lows after the first spike were around $0.24 so if it's like Bitcoin there should be a support level somewhere around there that may allow a dip to below $0.25 even if briefly. Maybe another hilarious meme investment will come out and people will pull out. Low confidence here

The one thing that dogecoin has not been in the year 2021 is a steady currency, (the only steady period was between Mid February to April 10th (that is a period lesser than the period remaining from today till Aug 1st). So assuming volatility will continue to be high.
On whether it will go higher or lower- i dont honestly dont know, i think its a much more volatile compared to other assets so if there is even a hint of tightening of monetary or fiscal measures it may go lower (much quicker than any other asset). On the other hand who knows what Elon musk will tweet tomorrow and what his loyal band of followers might do .With all that we have seen over the past year (hertz and gamestop saga) anything is possible. It seems as if you dont really need a plausible reason for anything to go up when interest rates are so close to zero.

non-zero chance of the meme being carried to new ATH just *for lolz*, if the summer brings yet another section of society into first contact with crypto. 
ETH gas fees alone make it unlikely to stay an agreed-upon store of value. No other function to that token. Therefore higher probability for price to collapse once hype subsides.

DOGE, c.p. would be valued at around 130bn USD if it were to hit 1.00 USD, and would thus be the third most valuable currency behind Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH), and it is not even crypto nor serves any purpose (such as remuneration for distributed computing) but is a token only. I thus exclude  bin 1. The altcoin bandwagon has moved on, and the hottest s**t at the moment seems to be meta-jokes: altcoins, some  referring to DOGE, with vast numbers of token in circulation and a very low to minimal initial coin offering price:
Shiba inu (SHIB)
SafeMoon (SAFE)
FEG token (FEG) However, there will be repeated attempts to blow up the DOGE value by people from the E.Musk ("a man like a walking SEC violation") circles, because it worked out so well in the past and because they can. Until they can't.
